channel.title: [HELP NEEDED] Client.jar is not starting up
channel.description:
So, I've jarred my RSPS client into a .jar file, but when I click on the .jar file - it doesn't open. Any suggestions on how to fix this? I'd appreciate it a lot!
Picture: http://gyazo.com/98b8047df11ac6edafc46fc1744cc007

item.title: [HELP NEEDED] Client.jar is not starting up
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“DexterD, post:7, topic:539998”][quote author=Pure_ link=topic=658848.msg4406750#msg4406750 date=1392225920]
When using the JAR creater set the main class?
[/quote]

I’ve been doing this:
http://gyazo.com/b1055397f14af72d391a03bd87d4e453

When I click ‘‘create jar’’ and actually want to open the .jar file - again, it won’t open.
This is seriously annoying me, and I’d be really happy if it would be fixed so I can play with my friends.[/quote]Are you sure it’s in the default package?

Read full topic
item.source: [HELP NEEDED] Client.jar is not starting up

item.title: [HELP NEEDED] Client.jar is not starting up
item.dc:creator: @DexterD DexterD

@DexterD wrote:

Pure_:

When using the JAR creater set the main class?

I’ve been doing this:
http://gyazo.com/b1055397f14af72d391a03bd87d4e453

When I click ‘‘create jar’’ and actually want to open the .jar file - again, it won’t open.
This is seriously annoying me, and I’d be really happy if it would be fixed so I can play with my friends.

item.source: [HELP NEEDED] Client.jar is not starting up

item.title: [HELP NEEDED] Client.jar is not starting up
item.dc:creator: @DexterD DexterD
item.description:
@DexterD wrote:

[quote=“Pure_, post:4, topic:539998”][quote author=DexterD link=topic=658848.msg4406734#msg4406734 date=1392224049]
I’m running it through Java Platform, but still it doesn’t open. Is there a possibility I jarred something wrong?

This is the message that pops up when I try to load it via .bat file:
http://gyazo.com/0447c2cdc91bbbfde78e75b194b483c6
[/quote]Jar manifest is incorrect, fix it or call the main class explicitly in command-line.[/quote]

And how do I fix it exactly?
This is what the run.bat file is:

@echo off Title Client cd ./Class/ START java -Xmx512m Gui 30 0 lowmem members 32 exit

Could you explain in a few steps on how to fix it? Thanks in advance.

Read full topic
item.source: [HELP NEEDED] Client.jar is not starting up

item.title: [HELP NEEDED] Client.jar is not starting up
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

You need to run it through a command-line interface, java -jar jar_file.jar.
